description: Often used to start the Rueda. From posición de casino (closed), both leader and follower step together toward the centre of the rueda on 1, then step back out on 5.
Basic Cuban salsa step used in Rueda; dancers step slightly back and forward. Hands closest to middle of circle meet on the 5.
Fundamental cross-body lead in Cuban style; switches partners' orientation.
Basic inside turn where leader redirects follower through the center.
Two consecutive enchufla turns.
Enchufla doble followed by a left turn by the lead, re-gripping with their right hand into another enchufla, followed by comb into dile que no
Leader presents the follower outward in a circular display turn.
Deli que no and leader leads follow in a left hand turn, leader steps to right and uses right arm to rotate follow around leader.
Step borrowed from Cuban Son footwork.
Often comes after Paso de son, lead steps around follow in clockwise direction
Stomp on 5 count towards center of circle
Partner exchange: take the next follower in the circle.
Skip one follower and take the second one.
Lead spins follow in a right turn, releases hand. "show it off."
Alternating display turns for leader and follower. Enchufla -> Leader goes under left arm, swapping positions with follow -> another enchufla -> dile que no

During dile que no, lead uses theirs left hand to lead the follow around their body (follow walks behind the lead in an anti-clockwise circle), switching to their right hand during the turn, then switching back to left hand at the end of rotation into guapea.
Lead switches hands, right hand turn followed by arm-over-head pattern resembling placing a hat.
Sombrero followed by mambo-style footwork.

Lead uses both hands to turn follow left on 1-2-3 into pretzel position, then rotate follow on 5-6-7 into reverse pretzel. 1-2-3 into preztel, then lead does a right turn, unravelling their arms into dile que no to finish
Sombrero then release left hand and re-catch in front of follow, lead follow forward into a pivot turn, then re-sombrero to finish.
Enchufla finished with arms held like "penguin wings." for next 8 count as you switch to next partner
Pose-like ending where dancers "freeze" briefly.
Enchufla followed by the leader waving their right hand across the follow from left to right as the follow leans back under their arm.  Lean back goes for 8 counts.
Enchufla with added mambo footwork on 1-3-5-7 as you switch partner.
Dame followed by partner exchange in opposite direction, so go back to follower on the lead's left, then cross them back into guapea
Circular arm-loop pattern resembling a lasso. Enchufla then lead goes under their left arm, still facing forward, and leads the follow back around into dile que no.

Switch hands, using right hand bring the follow in front of leader.  Leader backsteps to the left and takes the follows left hand with their left, switching sides as the follow pivots on the 3 and 7.  Afer 3 full 8 counts, end in dile que no.

Enchufla and switch hands with leader ending up in front of follow in shadow position.  Leader backsteps with follow on opposite side for two 8 counts, then raises right arm for follow to end up ready for sombrero, dile que no to finish
Often comes from paso de son, closed position where lead pivots the follow slightly facing the centre of the circle.
Lead uses left hand to lead follow in a right turn
Using left hand, lead follow in a right turn, using right hand to block follow's right shoulder on the 3 count, then follow unwraps on the 5-6-7
Siete followed by left turn (using lead's left arm) into a coca cola.
Leader changes hands, leads follow in a right turn, then hooks left arm with follows right arm and rotates around for another 8 count, into dile que no to finish
Lead turns follow into a right turn with hammerlock, rotation 360 degrees as he completes the turn, followed by a para ti para mi (lead goes under their right arm on their turn).
Dame dos but with two claps as you're rotating
Vacila into closed position
In closed position, lead raises left arm and travels forward under arm to next follow
Closed position, walk forwards, anti-clockwise around the circle.
Enchufla followed by leader performing a right turn and switching hands, into a single-handed dile que no.
Closed position, walk backwards, clockwise around the circle.
Lead pulls follow into closed position and turns 180 degrees, followed by lefting left arm and travelling undfer to next partner.
Prima but after travelling under left arm perform enchufla into partner swap.
Hermana followed by linking right arms together, step around in 360 through 8 count into partner swap.
Familia followed by linking left arms with new partner, rotating 180 back to previous partner, into vacila.
Lead follow in a sombrero right turn over first 8 count, followed by an enchufla and a right turn by the lead over the next 8 count, followed by another enchufla, into sombrero to finish.
Lead follow in a sombrero right, then lead follow behind the lead in a clockwise direction, lead will bring their right arm over the head, into a second sombrero to finish.
Lead pulls the follow forward on the 1 as they switch to follower on their left.
Clap hands on 1 count.
Clap hands on 1-2 counts.
Clap hands on 1-2-3 counts.

Enchufla followed by the lead stepping into centre of circle on the 1 into a basic salsa step.  The follows step into the centre of the circle on the 5. Directional calls such as Izquierda or Derecha may be added while in the center.
Directional call given while in Enchufla el Centro; leader rotates to the left before exiting. Include Mujeres for follows to rotate instead.
Directional call given while in Enchufla el Centro; leader rotates to the right before exiting. Include Mujeres for follows to rotate instead.
